page.title: 01MALBOROUGH
page.content: {Malborough}is a small village about four miles S.S.W. of{Kingsbridge in{South Devon.}Its population is just under{one thousand.}It has a {school,a church,a chapel,shops,a post {office,two garages,a village hall {playing fields,a coffee shop,two {public houses,a bakery,a residential {home for the elderly and one {hotel.}Most of the surrounding {contryside}is farmed.{Galmpton}is about a mile and three quarters W.N.W. of Malborough.Galmpton is in South Huish Parish .There is also a church in Galmpton.The hamlet of Bolberry is about a mile and a half W.S.W. of Malborough.The houses in the village vary greatly in design and age.Quite a few of them are thatched and are small.Many of the old houses are made of{cob.}Even so there are many new houses as well.
